advice: Eat small, frequent meals and avoid spicy or greasy foods.
Stay hydrated with clear fluids and get plenty of rest. Seek help if persistent.
Lie down in a quiet, dark room and drink water. Call a doctor if it's severe or persistent.
Mild pain may be normal, but if it's sharp or consistent, contact your healthcare provider.
This may be serious—seek immediate medical attention.
Get plenty of rest, eat iron-rich foods, and stay hydrated.
Sit or lie down immediately. Eat regularly and avoid sudden position changes.
Take breaks often and sleep propped up. Seek help if breathing becomes difficult.
Elevate your feet when sitting and avoid standing for long periods. Call a doctor if swelling is sudden or severe.
Monitor closely and inform your doctor immediately. May indicate preeclampsia.
May be a sign of high blood pressure or preeclampsia—seek immediate medical care.
Use a warm compress, maintain good posture, and avoid heavy lifting.
If regular and increasing in intensity, call your doctor—it may be labor.
Stay hydrated, rest, and take doctor-approved medication. Call your provider if it persists.
Try light, nutritious snacks throughout the day and stay hydrated. Discuss with your doctor if it continues.
